member.summary: Creates a quoted string (starting and ending with '"').
member.remarks: This method does not validate whether there are additional quotes ('"') within the string. It only checks whether the string starts and ends with a quote, and if not then quotes it.
member.param: The string to quote.
member.returns: The quoted string

member.summary: Splits a string into segments based on a given . The segments are trimmed and empty segments are removed.

An array of Unicode characters that delimit the substrings in this instance, an empty array that contains no delimiters, or null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.AppServiceHttpClient.GetRawTokenAsync(System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Calls the App Service Authentication module to retrieve the access token for the specified auth token and token provider name.
member.param: The Web site from which to request tokens. For example: 'https://www.contoso.com'.
The auth token that App Service Authentication issued for the current user. Used for authentication and identification.
The token provider for which the associated access token will be retrieved. 'Facebook', 'Google', or 'Twitter', for example.
member.returns: A with user details.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry
member.summary: Common data contract for storing provider-specific security tokens.
member.remarks: This is a strongly-typed token container class. Not all token types will apply to all providers. Null-valued properties will be explicitly excluded from the serialized JSON ().

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.ProviderName
member.summary: The well-known alias of the provider that issued the token (e.g. "aad").

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets a friendly, provider-specific User ID for the current entry (e.g. "name@contoso.com").

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets or sets an OAuth 1.0a/2.0 access token for the current entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.AccessTokenSecret
member.summary: Gets or sets an OAuth 1.0a access token secret for the current entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.ExpiresOn
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time on which the OAuth 2.0 access token expires.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.RefreshToken
member.summary: Gets or sets an OAuth 2.0 refresh token for the current entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.IdToken
member.summary: Gets or sets an OpenID Connection ID token for the current entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.AuthenticationToken
member.summary: Gets or sets an authentication token for the current entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppService.TokenEntry.UserClaims
member.summary: Gets or sets provider-specific user claims for this current entry.

member.summary: Validates a string representation of a mobile service authentication token used to authenticate a user request.

The secret key with which the token has been signed.
The valid audiences to accept in token validation.

member.returns: true if is valid; otherwise false/

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.IAppServiceTokenHandler.CreateUserId(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a user id value contained within a . The user id is of the form ProviderName:ProviderId where the ProviderName is the unique identifier for the login provider and the ProviderId is the provider specific id for a given user.
member.param: The login provider name.
The provider specific user id.
member.returns: A formatted representing the resulting value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.IAppServiceTokenHandler.TryParseUserId(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Parses a user id into its two components: a ProviderName which uniquely identifies the login provider and the ProviderId which identifies the provider specific id for a given user.
member.param: The input value to parse.
The login provider name; or null if the is not valid.
The provider specific user id; or null is the is not valid.
member.returns: true if is valid; otherwise false/

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Mobile.Server.Authentication.AppServiceTokenHandler.ValidateToken(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates the specified JWT token string against the specified secret key. Exceptions thrown by the validation method are not caught.
member.param: The JWT token string to validate.
The key to use in the validation.
The audience to use in validation.
The issuer to use in validation.
member.exception: Thrown if the JWT token is malformed.
Thrown if one of the method parameters are null or empty.
Thrown if the JWT token fails validation.
Thrown if the JWT token is expired.
Thrown if the JWT token is not yet valid.
